metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7903 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in OpenJPEG before r2911 in PDFium, as used in Google Chrome before 39.0.2171.65, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted JPEG image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7903` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064
chromium-browser-l10n - 39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064
chromium-chromedriver - 39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064').
